newsitem.title: BRAZIL: HSBC takes control of Bamerindus insurer.
newsitem.headline: HSBC takes control of Bamerindus insurer.

text.p: Banco HSBC Bamerindus SA has assumed control of Bamerindus Companhia de Seguros, the insurance branch of formerly Brazil's Banco Bamerindus, said a spokesman for the new bank.
The insurer is part of Bamerindus' assets that were taken over by HSBC Holdings Plc.

Under a deal announced by the Central Bank last week, HSBC, which already owned a minority stake in Bamerindus, assumed some of the bank's assets and obligations, valued at 10 billion reais, and turned it into a new institution with an immediate $1.0 billion capital injection.
The spokesman also said HSBC Bamerindus, which opened on Monday, plans to expand the bank's branch network to 1,500 branches from the current 1,206.
"The idea is return to the number of branches the bank had in 1985," he said.
Michael Geoghegan, HSBC Bamerindus president, told reporters the bank plans to build a new team of directors, adding that he is looking for a Brazilian executive for the bank's vice-presidency.
